intro: Thlasidia integrifolia, commonly known as the slender thlasia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions. Thlasidia integrifolia is often found in heathlands and is adapted to drought conditions.
